answers.answer: New arrivals in Brașov can find information on how to manage in the city and who can help them through various services listed on the page.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: You can contact the Integration Center for Migrants Brașov via email at migrantbrasov@gmail.com or contact@migrantbrasov.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The Brașov County Immigration Service can be contacted via email at bv.igi@mai.gov.ro or by phone at 0268-409956, 0268-409955, 0268-409759, 0268-409953, or 0268-409957.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Important contacts'.

answers.answer: The CATTIA Community Center offers information, food, transport to accommodation, counseling, and assistance for the reception of Ukrainian refugees.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'CATTIA Community Center'.

answers.answer: The CATTIA Community Center operates around the clock.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'CATTIA Community Center'.

answers.answer: The provided content states that information is required for the accommodation, board, and integration support program, but it does not specify what exact information is needed.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'The support program for accommodation, meals and integration in Brașov'.

answers.answer: Uninsured people can access medical services through primary healthcare providers working under contract with CASJ Brașov, a list of which is available.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: The Motivation Foundation Romania can offer wheelchairs, walking frames, or crutches to refugees from Ukraine with locomotor disabilities or mobility impairments. They can be contacted at 0735.355.894 or c.lupu@motivation.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Medical services'.

answers.answer: Organizations offering psychological support in Brașov include Swiss Solidarity, Terre des hommes Foundation, World Vision Romania, The International Organization for Migration (IOM), Plan International Organization, Red Cross Romania, and the AMURTEL team.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: Children can enroll in Brașov schools by submitting applications physically at the Brașov County School Inspectorate (Shirul Gheorghe Dima no. 4) or online at info@isjbrasov.ro.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Educational events for children and adults are available at the CATTIA center with Worldvision's support, requiring a form to be filled out for participation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Public libraries in Brașov provide Romanian language courses specifically for Ukrainians.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Organisations offering their support'.

answers.answer: NGO Terre des Hommes provides psychological help, including referrals to information resources, community-based psychosocial support, targeted psychosocial services, mental health awareness, and psychological first aid. They serve various vulnerable groups including refugees, children, and pregnant/nursing women.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Psychological support'.

answers.answer: In Brașov, you can use the public transport system, RATBV, for free by showing an ID if requested.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Transportation'.

answers.answer: Women can access support in reproductive health services and navigate the health system through the Women's Center.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Women's Center'.

answers.answer: People living with HIV in Romania can receive free, anonymous, and confidential psycho-medical-social services from specialist doctors at 10 Regional HIV Centers and with the support of Sens Pozitiv.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/dopomoha-brasov and read the section under 'Counseling for people living with HIV'.
